title: Navratri 2015 Special: Top 10 Bollywood Dandiya songs that will spice up the Garba season!
text:
Navratri 2015 Special: Top 10 Bollywood Dandiya songs that will spice up the Garba season! By Zainab Mulla on October 13, 2015 at 6:03 PM Comments 
Navratri festival – the best time for Dandiya, Garba Raas and some naach gaana on typical Bollywood songs. Bollywood movies and especially their songs have always made their presence felt during this festival. People dance in such a way like no one’s watching them and need some tadakta phadakta music where they can show off their new moves. (Read: Navratri 2015 Special: The 9 different avatars of Goddess Durga) 
The nine-day Navratri celebrations are always filled with great joy, enthusiasm, devotion and passion. Devotees of Goddess Durga observe rigorous fast and sing various kinds of mantras which are dedicated to Goddess. They dance and celebrate the victory of Maa Durga through Garba songs and Dandiya nights. 
Prem Ratan Dhan Payo – Prem Leela 
Prem leela song is based on Ram Leela and has been beautifully composed by Himmesh Reshammiya. The colourful and attractive setup of this song has portrayed the story of Ram and Leela perfectly. The lyrics of the song have been jotted down by Irshad Kamil. So, what are you waiting for start practicing dance for the Navratri night on this amazing song from Prem Ratan Dhan Payo’. 
Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam – Dholi Taro Dhol Baaje 
Dholi Taro Dhol Baaje is a romantic track which features Salman Khan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan. Sanjay Leela Bhansali has beautifully picturised the tragic love story. Dholi Taro Dhol Baaje is a perfect song for the Garba night which represents every color of the festival. This song is on the hit list and everyone just wants to shake their hips like the stars did in the video. The beats of the melody are so energetic that one cannot refuse to dance on this one. 
Aap Mujhe Achche Lagne Lage – O Re Gori 
O Re Gori – beautifully sung by Udit Narayan and Alka Yagnik and features Hrithik Roshan and Ameesha Patel. ‘O Re Gori’ is a long nine-minute Garba song which is quite enjoyable and peppy at the same time. Hrithik and Ameesha both are shown playing Garba and Dandiya in this song with a traditional beat. The song has perfectly used suitable instruments and is a treat to hear. There chemistry is just adorable and creates perfect atmosphere for garba raas. The whole concept of the lyrics defines the personality of male and female with slow and romantic melody. 
Lagaan - Radha Kaise Na Jale 
‘Radha Kaise Na Jale’ from Lagaan movie which features Aamir Khan & Gracy Singh. Aamir and Gracy’s beautiful and elegant moves make this song best. Gracy’s perfect emotions and moves made this song visual appealing. This song recreates the magical story of Radha and Krishna. The song starts with dandiya and a possessive factor which is greatly highlighted by Gracy. The melodious lyrics of the song were been jotted by Javed Akhtar who wonderfully depicted the feeling of love and jealousy that one has when he/she is in love. Finally Aamir teaches and preaches well by saying love has a different and unique language, but it can be exchanged with our mates. 
Goliyon Ki Rasleela Ram – Nagada Sang Dhol 
Nagada Sang Dhol Baaje song features the leggy lass of Bollywood Deepika Padukone in a never-seen-before avatar. The diva gathered praises for her outstanding performance and graceful dancing moves. 
Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon - Bani Bani 
The seven-minute song features Hrithik Roshan , Kareena Kapoor and Abhishek Bachchan in the main roles. Bani Bani music was composed by Anu Malik and sung by Chitra. The song starts with Kareena’s elegant moves to the Dandiya beats. The song is beautiful but twisted with love triangles in it. Kareena in this movie is shown as an independent girl who likes to live on her own terms. The mixture of Dandiya beats and drums are used beautifully which stand out from the rest of the song. 
Suhaag - Sabse Bada Tera Naam 
This song is especially dedicated to Maa Durga which is still popular and very trendy. Suhaag song features Amitabh Bachchan and Rekha in the lead roles. Laxmikant Pyarelal had composed the music for the same. ‘Sabse Bada Tera Naam’ is devotional melody which is on every devotees mind. This melody is sung by Mohammed Rafi and Asha Bhosle, which not only gives it a spiritual touch, but makes it also a delight to ear. 
What can be best than Bollywood songs that showcase perfect connecting between hearts with the thread of love? On the auspicious day, we have a list of Bollywood Dandiya Garba songs that will spice up your mood. We share the foot-tapping and hip shaking garba songs with you. Check out the video songs and dance to its beats and depict the true form of love in Garba Raas. Happy Navratri!
